results.title: Going to school in Australia
results.creator_credit: Austarama Television, Nicholas and Kenneth Mott
results.brief_description: A film designed to instruct immigrants to Australia on the nature of the Australian and especially the Victorian education systems. Two representatives in the field of migrant education are questioned about how parents may proceed to enrol their children at school, the different kinds of schools in the Australian system, their various functions and facilities, adult education and several other facets of the education system. Narrated by Barry McQueen.

results.title: Going to school
results.creator_credit: Dept of Education, New Zealand and David Gibson
results.brief_description: Explores a child’s first days at school. This exciting experience has its problems, fears and joys. It also describes the parents and teachers reactions. Suitable for tertiary and teacher levels.

results.title: Going through customs
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rolly Productions and Rolly Desmarais
results.brief_description: Every day, streams of people, goods and commodities of all descriptions come into Canada at border crossings along the 6 500 km Canada-U.S. border, and via airports and seaports. Keeping the traffic moving expeditiously, at the same time ensuring that Canadian government regulations concerning immigration, customs and excise, health, and agriculture are observed, is the job of the Customs Officer. This is a colorful, coast-to-coast look at the variety that enters into his day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Rolly Productions and Rolly Desmarais

results.title: Going the distance
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Jacques Bobet and Paul Cowan
results.brief_description: The official film of the XI Commonwealth Games held in Edmonton, Canada, in August 1978. An international sports event occurring every four years, the games draw hundreds of athletes from the many nations of the Commonwealth. Eight athletes from four continents were selected to illustrate the nature of individual effort. They were filmed in their home countries before the Games, and in competition in Edmonton, Canada.

results.title: Going places
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, Peter Bradford and Charles Mapleston
results.brief_description: Designed to set people talking about the whole problem of transportation. Eight independent experts in the field of transport discuss problems arising from the ever-increasing number of vehicles using Britain’s heavily congested roads. Points out how mobility is associated with danger, damage, noise, pollution and ugliness and the need to create a transport system which will improve both communications and the environment.

results.title: Going outside: to play, to imagine, to learn
results.creator_credit: Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.) and Rick Cavaggion
results.brief_description: Outlines ways in which teachers can develop children’s awareness of the natural environment. In a bush setting, five to eleven-year-olds role play the Dam Conflict Game, learning how to become involved in an issue and how to communicate their feelings.

results.title: Going on to further study (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A humorous examination of the advantages and importance of further education to; a)levels of skill needed to match those of other countries and ; b)our children will have more time to devote to things other than earning a living. Further education gives them a better understanding of their place in the world and of themselves.

results.title: Going my way
results.brief_description: This is the nostalgic and heartwarming story of young Father O’Malley (Bing Crosby), sent by his Bishop to help Father Fitzgibbon (Barry Fitzgerald) at the mortgage-ridden St Dominic’s parish. Initially, the younger priest’s unconventional methods antagonise his gruff superior, but eventually Father O’Malley wins over the elderly priest, organises a gang of unruly kids into a choir, and rescues the parish from debt. Bing Crosby sings the famed songs: “Too-Ra-Loo-Ra-Loo-Ra” and “Swinging on a star”. This outstanding film won 7 Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Actor (Bing Crosby) and Best Supporting Actor (Barry Fitzgerald).

results.title: Going metric
results.brief_description: Examines practical details of changing to the metric system in a precision engineering company. Discusses replacement and adaptation problems in machinery, tools and supplies, the drawing office and staff training.
